answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hi Mark,
It would be very useful for you to see a previous question we received on the KN called Use of Alternative Fuels in City Fleets. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/20538
In response, Evelina Moulder from ICMA had put up a list of local governments that are using fuel efficient vehicles. You may wish to contact some of them directly. The other responses provided additional information based on practical experience of integrating CNG. Charles Warrington has also provided three contact people for further enquiries. David Robinson mentions an ICMA on demand webinar called “Sustainable Communities: How Greening Up Your Fleet Results in Huge Cost Savings,” that should provide additional tips. 
I also found a few documents on the wed:

The Department of Fleet Management of Chicago that includes an affidavit of joint venture. 
http://www.cityofchicago.org/content/dam/city/depts/dps/ContractAdministration/Specs/2011/Spec96665.pdf 
A press release from a nonprofit that highlights safety procedures regarding the conversion of vehicles to CNG. It also provides  a list of EPA certified engine retrofit systems. 
http://www.cleanvehicle.org/committee/technical/PDFs/Conversion_Press_Release.pdf
And finally a link from the Texas government regarding contract details for “Retail Purchase of Alternative Fuel (LPG) and (CNG).”
http://www.window.state.tx.us/procurement/contracts/gci/405-M2.php 

I hope this is helpful,
Pooja Varma 
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
pvarma@icma.org

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text:
I am looking for contacts wtih communities who have converted vehicles to CNG.  We are preparing  to start converting vehicles and I would like to know any tips you may have.
Thank you.
Mark Abeles-Allison
Bayfield County, WI
title: COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS VEHICLE CONVERSIONS
